content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.115 - Executive Order No. 115: Declaring a Disaster Emergency in Erie County and Contiguous Areas. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on December 24, 2001, and continuing, severe snowstorms came through New York State and disrupted vital public
transportation and public safety systems within Erie County and contiguous
areas; and
WHEREAS, this event resulted in personal hardship and
continues to pose a threat to the public health and safety; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, do hereby find that a disaster has occurred for which the affected
local governments are unable to respond adequately. Therefore, pursuant to the
authority vested in me by the Constitution of the State of New York, including
section 28 of article 2-B of the Executive Law, I hereby declare a State

Disaster Emergency effective December 24, 2001, within the territorial
boundaries of Erie County and contiguous areas; and
FURTHER, pursuant to section 29 of article 2-B of the

Executive Law, I direct the implementation of the State Disaster Preparedness

Plan and authorize, effective December 24, 2001 and continuing, the State

Emergency Management Office, the Department of Agriculture and Markets, the

Department of Transportation, the Thruway Authority, the State Police, the

Division of Military and Naval Affairs, the Department of Environmental

Conservation, the Department of Health, the Office of Mental Health, the State

Department of Correctional Services, the Public Service Commission, the Office
of Fire Prevention and Control, the Department of Labor, the Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation and other State agencies as necessary, to
take appropriate action to protect State property and to assist those affected
local governments and individuals in responding to and recovering from this
disaster, and to provide such other assistance as necessary to protect the
public health and safety. FURTHER, I have designated Edward F. Jacoby, Jr., Director
of the State Emergency Management Office (SEMO) as the State Coordinating

Officer for this event. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: December 28, 2001
